title: iPad 11 drops to lowest price yet
description: A new iPad deal offers big discounts on multiple models of Apple's tablet, including the entry-level iPad 11 with 128GB storage. (via Cult of Mac - Apple news, rumors, reviews and how-tos)
author: David Snow
excerpt: A new iPad deal offers big discounts on multiple models of Apple's tablet, including the entry-level iPad 11 with 128GB storage.
text: Deals Get the latest, greatest budget iPad at an early discount. Photo: Apple The best deal we’ve seen on the new iPad 11 takes $22 off the tablet’s retail price of $349. That drops the entry-level tablet to its best price yet: $327. Note: This rock-bottom deal is for the blue model only; the silver, yellow and pink models will cost you a dollar or two more. The budget iPad, which Apple announced in May, offers solid performance for basic tasks like surfing the web, streaming videos and handling email. Plus, it comes with a welcome boost over the iPad 10’s base level of storage. Speaking of which, if you can get by with the previous-gen tablet, another deal drops the 10th-gen iPad with 64GB of storage to just $269.99. You can bump up to the iPad 10 with 256GB of storage for just $394.99 (or add cellular to that model for $549). This post contains affiliate links. Cult of Mac may earn a commission when you use our links to buy items. iPad deal: Save on iPad 11 (newest model) Best budget tablet Apple iPad 11-inch (2025 model with A16 chip) Apple's entry-level tablet gets a solid upgrade, with a welcome boost to the base model's storage. It's a great option for watching videos, checking emails, surfing the web and more. Pros:A16 processorUltra Wide 12MP front camera supports Center StageStorage starts at 128GB Cons:Does not support Apple Intelligence. When Apple CEO Steve Jobs demoed the first iPad in 2010, the tablet made waves in the tech world. Everybody wanted that thin slab of glass that seemed like the ultimate magical computing device. When the original iPad went on sale later that year, it set records for Apple. Since then, Apple has continually raised the bar with regular upgrades. (The company also introduced three new models: iPad Air, iPad Pro and iPad mini). The entry-level iPad in this deal still delivers excellent performance and value, with Apple’s typical premium hardware design. It’s the right choice for anyone looking for a device for consuming content, performing basic tasks and playing Apple Arcade games. (For an in-depth look at various iPad models, see our buying guide: How to choose the right iPad for you.) If you need a new iPad, this deal delivers a quality Apple tablet at a pretty amazing price. iPad (11 inch, 2025 model) This deal on the latest version of the budget iPad lands you one of Apple’s most popular tablets. This year’s iPad 11 model comes with a faster A16 processor and doubles the base storage capacity to 128KB. Otherwise, the tablet maintains the same basic specs as the iPad 10. Perhaps the biggest surprise is that the A16 processor does not support Apple Intelligence, the perhaps overhyped suite of AI features. That means no Writing Tools, no Genmoji, no sappy AI-generated images in Image Playground, etc. Most people can live without these tools. The tablet comes in four colors: silver, blue, pink and yellow. This iPad deal currently applies to all colors except for yellow. It's a great option for watching videos, checking emails, surfing the web and more. Completely redesigned, it has a modern, all-screen design, faster processor and better cameras. Everything you want in an iPad at an affordable price. Pros:Cool modern designBig 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display12MP front and back camerasWi-Fi 6 for fast streaming Cons:Limited 64GB storageNo Apple Intelligence
html:
• Deals

The best deal we’ve seen on the new iPad 11 takes $22 off the tablet’s retail price of $349. That drops the entry-level tablet to its best price yet: $327. Note: This rock-bottom deal is for the blue model only; the silver, yellow and pink models will cost you a dollar or two more.

The budget iPad, which Apple announced in May, offers solid performance for basic tasks like surfing the web, streaming videos and handling email. Plus, it comes with a welcome boost over the iPad 10’s base level of storage.

Speaking of which, if you can get by with the previous-gen tablet, another deal drops the 10th-gen iPad with 64GB of storage to just $269.99. You can bump up to the iPad 10 with 256GB of storage for just $394.99 (or add cellular to that model for $549).

This post contains affiliate links. Cult of Mac may earn a commission when you use our links to buy items.

iPad deal: Save on iPad 11 (newest model)

Best budget tablet

Apple iPad 11-inch (2025 model with A16 chip)

Apple's entry-level tablet gets a solid upgrade, with a welcome boost to the base model's storage. It's a great option for watching videos, checking emails, surfing the web and more.

Pros:

  • A16 processor
  • Ultra Wide 12MP front camera supports Center Stage
  • Storage starts at 128GB

Cons:

  • Does not support Apple Intelligence.

When Apple CEO Steve Jobs demoed the first iPad in 2010, the tablet made waves in the tech world. Everybody wanted that thin slab of glass that seemed like the ultimate magical computing device. When the original iPad went on sale later that year, it set records for Apple. Since then, Apple has continually raised the bar with regular upgrades. (The company also introduced three new models: iPad Air, iPad Pro and iPad mini).

The entry-level iPad in this deal still delivers excellent performance and value, with Apple’s typical premium hardware design. It’s the right choice for anyone looking for a device for consuming content, performing basic tasks and playing Apple Arcade games. (For an in-depth look at various iPad models, see our buying guide: How to choose the right iPad for you.)

If you need a new iPad, this deal delivers a quality Apple tablet at a pretty amazing price.

iPad (11 inch, 2025 model)

This deal on the latest version of the budget iPad lands you one of Apple’s most popular tablets. This year’s iPad 11 model comes with a faster A16 processor and doubles the base storage capacity to 128KB. Otherwise, the tablet maintains the same basic specs as the iPad 10.

Perhaps the biggest surprise is that the A16 processor does not support Apple Intelligence, the perhaps overhyped suite of AI features. That means no Writing Tools, no Genmoji, no sappy AI-generated images in Image Playground, etc. Most people can live without these tools.

The tablet comes in four colors: silver, blue, pink and yellow. This iPad deal currently applies to all colors except for yellow.

Buy from: Amazon

Best budget tablet

Apple iPad 11-inch (2025 model with A16 chip)

Apple's entry-level tablet gets a solid upgrade, with a welcome boost to the base model's storage. It's a great option for watching videos, checking emails, surfing the web and more.

Pros:

  • A16 processor
  • Ultra Wide 12MP front camera supports Center Stage
  • Storage starts at 128GB

Cons:

  • Does not support Apple Intelligence.

iPad (10th generation)

As mentioned, the launch of the iPad 11 means you can score even better deals on the iPad 10:

  • iPad (10th generation) with A14 Bionic chip, 10.9-inch Liquid Retina Display, 64GB SSD, Wi-Fi 6, 12MP front/12MP Back Camera, Touch ID, blue or silver colors — $259.99
  • iPad (10th generation) with A14 Bionic chip, 10.9-inch Liquid Retina Display, 256GB SSD, Wi-Fi 6, 12MP front/12MP Back Camera, Touch ID, blue or silver colors — $499 $429.99 (with coupon box checked, see price at checkout)
  • iPad (10th generation): with A14 Bionic chip, 10.9-inch Liquid Retina Display, 256GB, Wi-Fi 6 + 5G Cellular, 12MP front/12MP Back Camera, Touch ID, blue, silver or yellow colors — $649 (currently not on sale)

Best budget iPad for years

Apple iPad (10th Generation)

4.5

The iPad 10th-generation is Apple's best entry-level iPad for years. Completely redesigned, it has a modern, all-screen design, faster processor and better cameras. Everything you want in an iPad at an affordable price.

Pros:

  • Cool modern design
  • Big 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display
  • 12MP front and back cameras
  • Wi-Fi 6 for fast streaming

Cons:

  • Limited 64GB storage
  • No Apple Intelligence
